Panorama Factory¶

class PanoramaFactory.PanoramaFactory[source]¶

Creates a panoramic view from point set based on a certain property (e.g. range, intesity, etc.) The panoramic view is stored as a PanoramaProperty object

Methods

CreatePanorama_byPoints(points[, …]) Create a PanoramaProperty object from a point set based on according to range or intensity
CreatePanorama_byProperty(pointSet_property) Creates panorama with the property as the values of the pixels.
_PanoramaFactory__computePanoramaIndices(…) Find the boundaries and the indices of the panorama
_PanoramaFactory__compute_void_as_mean(ranges) Sets the void value as the mean value of the ranges
classmethod CreatePanorama_byPoints(points, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a PanoramaProperty object from a point set based on according to range or intensity

Parameters:
  • points (PointSet) – The point set to create the panorama from can be either a PointSet, PointSubSet or BaseProperty-derived objects
  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)
  • elevationSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction
  • intensity – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.
  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges
Returns:

panorama_property
Return type:

PanoramaProperty

classmethod CreatePanorama_byProperty(pointSet_property, azimuthSpacing=0.057, elevationSpacing=0.057, intensity=False, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates panorama with the property as the values of the pixels.

Parameters:
  • pointSet_property (BaseProperty) – any PointSet property according to which the pixel’s value should be
  • azimuthSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the azimuth direction (scan property)
  • elevationSpacing (float) – The spacing between two points of the point set in the elevation direction
  • intensity – if the pixel’s value should be the intensity value.
  • voidData (float) – the number to set where there is no data
  • void_as_mean (bool) – flag to determine the void value as the mean value of the ranges
Returns:

panorama_property
Return type:

PanoramaProperty
